page.title: 16"BROADOAKS",WIMBISH
page.content: Mr.and Mrs.McLoed have lived at "Broadoaks"for 25 years.When they first moved in there was no electricity.The original house was built in 1560,and part of it remains as it was,whilst other parts were rebuilt in the 19th.century.The grounds cover 240 acres,including a farm and large gardens as well as a hard tennis court. The{staircase}has been renewed recently and the{panelling}in the drawing room has been replaced.The dining room wall is original,and so is the fireplace on the landing. The most interesting feature of "Broadoaks"is a{priest hole}which opens from the chapel fireplace.This was built in 1569,and the priest{John {Gerrard}hid there for about four days in 1593,and was not found although the soldiers ransacked the house.
